text: Broken Hill is a mining town in the center of Australia. It is located west of Sydney, whilst Adelaide is to the southwest. About 17,500 people live in Broken Hill. There was a short gold rush, in 1848. No gold was found, and there was very little water. Later silver was found in the area around the town and some mines around Broken Hill still operate. There are passenger trains to and from Sydney and buses to and from Dubbo. Category:Towns in New South Wales
title: Broken Hill
